text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 4.71.7 contains procedures for surveying EP examinations of Form 5500, Form 5329, Form 5330, Form 990-T, Non-Return Units (NRU), and Form 1040/Form 1120 discrepancy adjustments.

Enhanced IRM 4.71.7.1, Program, Scope and Objectives, and the subsections thereunder, by adding more information on the internal controls regulating EP Examinations. Reorganized material for improved readability and uniformity with other EP, Examination IRMs.
more information on the internal controls regulating EP Examinations. Reorganized material for improved readability and uniformity with other EP, Examination IRMs. (

Revisions were made throughout the IRM to incorporate the October 2, 2018 memorandum from the Acting Director, Government Entities/Shared Services titled, Revised Process for Surveying a Case When Using Certain Non-examination Disposal Codes.
This supersedes IRM 4.71.7 dated November 21, 2017.

) The Employee Plans (EP) examination program was established to a. Compliance with the provisions of Internal Revenue Code (IRC) Scope and b. That taxes related to trust assets are being properly reported. (
) Purpose: IRM
, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Survey Returns, contains procedures for surveying EP examinations of Form Form
, Form
-T, Non-Return Units (NRU), and Form
/Form discrepancy adjustments. (
) Audience: This IRM provides procedures for agents, managers, and staff in EP Examinations. (
) Program Owner: Director, EP Examinations sets the program for the EP amination program. (
) Program Authority: EP Examinations’ authority to resolve issues is from its authority to make determinations of tax liability under IRC
) EP Examination’s authority to resolve issues is derived from its authority to make determinations of tax liability under IRC
EP Examination is the division designated to determine if a retirement plan is qualiﬁed under IRC
, and the underlying regulations, and thus, exempt from tax under IRC (
) EP Examinations established two review groups to make sure agents examinations per technical, procedural and administrative requirements: Controls a. Mandatory Review, see IRM
, Employee Plans Examination Returns, EP Mandatory Review. b. Special Review, see IRM
, Special Review (SR) and Tax Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures. (
) Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) is the quality control system TE/GE uses to oversee the entire examination program. For more formation on TEQMS, see IRM
, Special Review (SR) and Tax Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures. (
) All examinations will be done in accordance with the Taxpayer Bill of listed in IRC
). Note: Find additional information at: Taxpayer Bill of Rights.

Employee Plans Examination of Returns

Form 5330 Return of Excise Taxes Related to Employee Beneﬁt Plans Form 5500 Annual Return/Report of Employee Beneﬁt Plan Form 5596 TE/GE Non-Examined Closings
Note: Cases controlled on NMF cannot be closed electronically as 100% paperless closing, therefore are excluded from this procedure.
The following types of returns are eligible to be closed by survey:

Consideration of existence and/or non-existence of classiﬁed issues Large, Unusual, or Questionable (LUQs) items, Completion of return and related return reconciliation, Completion of required ﬁling checks, Evaluation of examination potential (e.g., whether an exam would result in a material change”, Consider whether this is a repetitive exam or compliance activity prior exam or compliance activity resulted in no change or minimal justments for same issue, Statute date is less than
months prior to expiration Lack of available resources to complete the exam, and

Employee Plans Examination of Note: Managers should coordinate with Area Manager to determine if case should/can be reassigned to another group/area that has cient resources to complete. h. Consider if steps were taken to correct an identiﬁed issue as reﬂected subsequent years’ return. (
) Any return closed from an EP group before assignment to an agent and contact with the taxpayer is considered surveyed before assignment. (

) If the main reason for the survey is due to a lack of resources, group managers should exercise due diligence, with their Area Manager’s to assess whether they can reassign the return to another group/area surveying it . (
) Returns surveyed before assignment are closed with disposal code
) Effective October
, Form
is no longer required to be when surveying a case before assignment. (

) Capture the information about the survey on the RCCMS closing record: a. Complete the designated mandatory ﬁelds for a surveyed closure . you select “Validate for: Close” in RCCMS, all required ﬁelds will be lighted in red font. b. Select the appropriate Survey Reason Code from the drop-down and provide a narrative explanation supporting your decision to survey in General tab, Remarks and Comments ﬁeld. (

) Managers will document their review and approval of the survey closure on RCCMS Case Chronology Record. a. Manager’s comments will include any applicable Special Handling in- structions as required. b. To add a manual chronology entry, click on the Chronology tab and select the new Chronology Button. c. The Untitled – Chronology Box opens and allows you to input various entries. d. Complete the required red asterisked ﬁelds. e. Click Save and Close to save your entry. (

) To allow Area offices ﬂexibility in managing workload, under certain circum- stances, cases may be surveyed after assignment even though initial was made by the agent, if no records were received. (
) If records were solicited and received, the case may not be surveyed. (

) As long as no records have been received and group manager approval obtained, an agent may survey a return if they believe the examination result in no material change in tax liability or result in no change in the qualiﬁed status of the plan. Note: If the main reason for the survey is due to a lack of resources, group managers should exercise due diligence, with their Area Manager’s agreement, to assess whether they can reassign the return to another area before surveying it Internal Revenue Manual Cat. Note: Use when you determine, after contacting the taxpayer, but inspecting records that:
Examining the return wouldn’t result in material change in qualiﬁcation or tax liability, or
The taxpayer is deceased, has a terminal illness, is in a area, or other extraordinary circumstances exist. When surveying a claim allowed in full, use disposal code
(AIMS)
(RCCMS). Note: Use when no taxpayer contact is made and you determine the claim issue is clearly allowable in full and the return doesn’t otherwise warrant examination.
Use when you determine, after contacting the taxpayer, but before inspecting records that:
Examining the return wouldn’t result in material change in plan qualiﬁcation or tax liability, or
The taxpayer is deceased, has a terminal illness, is in a area, or other extraordinary circumstances exist.
otherwise warrant examination. (
) Surveys of returns no longer require a paper ﬁle as RCCMS has been enhanced to process the closing action directly to AIMS. (
) Except for cases controlled on NMF, all surveyed cases will be closed fully electronically as
% paperless closings. Note: Cases controlled on NMF cannot be closed electronically as
% closing. (
) A notation should be made in the Message screen and in the Compliance screen in RCCMS that the case is fully electronic. Note: To have an electronic
% paperless closing, the return must have been established using Return Requisition Code
– Return, Chargeout & Not Requested. Additionally, the Closing With ﬁeld on the General Tab of Closing Record must be completed by selecting option
– Paperless Non- Examined. (
) For cases controlled on NMF, printed paper copies of the following must be included in the case ﬁle when the case is closed from the group to TE/GE Closing Group: a. Form

b. The return being surveyed (if applicable) Note: Any surveyed return will be stamped with a “Closed Survey After Assignment” stamp or a “Closed Survey Before Assignment” and must be signed by the agent and the group manager approving survey. Do not stamp an original ﬁled return; instead make a of any original return and stamp the copy. c. Any other relevant documents (
) When closing the case in RCCMS: a. Make sure the closing tab has the “Survey Reason Code” completed. b. Make sure disposal code
is entered for a “Survey After c. Make sure disposal code
is entered for a “Survey Before Assign- ment.” d. Select, “Closing with Original Return”.

4.71.7.4.1 (10-04-2019) Survey Reason Codes (SRC)

Narrative statements are optional for Survey Reason Codes A – D but explain details if you think it’s appropriate. For example, for Survey Reason Code A, include speciﬁc details as to why you have determined the classiﬁed issue(s) doesn’t exist. This will help in reﬁning the workload selection process.
Employee Plans Examination of Returns

b. Explain why we aren’t examining the return. The justiﬁcation is critical, we can monitor and analyze trends as to why cases are being surveyed to improve our processes. A generic entry such as “survey” is not able. (

) Acceptable examples for Survey Reason Code E (Other), include: • Claim Allowed in Full. • During pre-examination research it was determined that the taxpayer has self-corrected the issue as reﬂected in subsequent years.
